Articles.Content:
Who's going to watch it? I am in !! Though I might not travel all the way up North for the full one I'll be quite happy with most of the Sun covered.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_eclipse_of_November_3,_2013
Dog Gammit! I'm not able to see that here in Norway... I hoped to look at it through my telescope :c
Hmm, I'll have to look out for this, even if I'm in the UK (that means clouds, rain, and, of course, how much of the Sun will actually be eclipsed)...

Hmm, I'll have to look out for this, even if I'm in the UK (that means clouds, rain, and, of course, how much of the Sun will actually be eclipsed)...

Unfortunatelly, you and I won't be able to see anything.
Will you be able to see it from Wisconsin?

Will you be able to see it from Wisconsin?

No, the path of the eclipse passes over the Atlantic and Africa in the map that lajos posted. You don't get to see one from Wisconsin until August of 2017. Even then it will only be a partial eclipse in Wisconsin. You'd have to drive south to see totality.

Definitely make the effort to see one if you can. I saw a total solar eclipse from Southern Germany in 1999. During totality, the street lights came on, the birds stopped singing... Everything was quiet. You could see the edge of the moon's shadow coming as the clouds started to light up again in the distance. The speed was immense. I have never felt so small and insignificant.

Where can I find if I will be able to see it from my place?

I hope I can!

EDIT: I checked it up,unfortunately it won't be visible from my place

Edited October 25, 2013 by goldenpeach

I'm going to watch it, but only just barely. At sunrise, the US East Coast will be able to see a partial eclipse. The best place to see it in the US is around NJ, CT, RI, and MA, which is where I live - the sun will be about 55% covered up at sunrise.

You'll be able to see part of it as far west as Atlanta, GA and Pittsburgh, PA.
Did anyone on the east coast of North America get up early this morning to catch the partial? What about you, WooDzor? Did you manage to get any photos from wherever it is that you are located?

I ended up with about 95%, 10 km out of Kampala, still pretty cool but close to impossible to take photos. Messed around with my phone and camera...of course ran out of power on my camera (kerbal style) and haven't yet charged it. I will check it tonight after work.

so this is a photo of the reflection of my phone lens reflecting in the back of the solar eclipse glasses...Once again I live by my sig

Awww dang i missed it. Although I would've seen a partial eclipse (I live in guyana)

I forgot about the damned thing....

I wont see another until 2017

I didn't know about it or I would've gotten up to see it along with the F1 race. I actually woke up at about the right time to see it, but I decided I'd just watch the DVR of the race later and went back to sleep. I would've had to drive to a clearing though, It would've been too low in the sky to see from where I live (Florida).
